direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods handle one-time transactions but focus on different aspects: submission and status checking.
Both methods involve transactions with similar control flows and parameter handling, focusing on different types of transactions (one-time vs. redemption).
The transaction history method can provide context and validation for the one-time transaction method, ensuring that the transaction was recorded correctly.
Both methods access and manipulate index-related data, which can be used to validate and enhance the one-time transaction method.
The source asset list method provides necessary information about available assets, which is crucial for the one-time transaction method.
